vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-eth
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function withdrawBalance() public {
        require(!locked[msg.sender]); // check if the user is already in the process of withdrawing
        locked[msg.sender] = true; // lock the user's account
        uint amountToWithdraw = userBalances[msg.sender];
        userBalances[msg.sender] = 0; // set the user's balance to 0 before sending ether

        require(msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)()); // send ether to the user

        locked[msg.sender] = false; // unlock the user's account
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in Reentrancy_secure.withdrawBalance (patch_12.sol#7-16):
	External calls:
	- require(bool)(msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)()) (patch_12.sol#13)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- locked (patch_12.sol#15)

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function

        require(!locked[msg.sender]); // check if the user is already in the process of withdrawing

        userBalances[msg.sender] = 0; // set the user's balance to 0 before sending ether

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:

        require(!locked[msg.sender]); // check if the user is already in the process of withdrawing
        locked[msg.sender] = true; // lock the user's account

vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in Reentrancy_secure.withdrawBalance (patch_12.sol#7-16):
	-require(bool)(msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)()) patch_12.sol#13

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
